intro: Scaphochlamys disticha, commonly known as the two-branched scaphochlamys, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers with four petals. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
